q: Mike Pence , a story Friday highlighted the effort by a group of conservatives, including former House Republican Majority Leader Dick Armey and former Dick Armey Jim Ryun , to convince him to run for president rather than Indiana governor. For them, the Hoosier checks many boxes- a fresh face on the national scene, a charismatic speaker from the heartland and, most important, a Republican who can appeal to all three elements of the party base: social conservatives, economic conservatives and foreign policy conservatives, the story said. Perhaps not surprisingly, Donald Rumsfeld by no means suggests that the war itself was a mistake. He holds to the theory that had the coalition forces not toppled Saddam Hussein , the whole region would be far more perilous than it is today. As for his own style of presentation, he was guilty of quips, he admits now, that would have been better unsaid, including "stuff happens" in reference to mass looting in Baghdad

Sunday. Media reports during Egypt's political unrest had quoted Zahi Hawass as saying that looters damaged two mummies, but in a BBC interview on Sunday he said that this was not the case. They were not mummies, there were two skulls taken outside from the CT scan machine. Everything will go back to normal at Cairo Museum today, said Zahi Hawass , head of Egypt's antiquities authority since 2002. He was made a cabinet minister last week.
